required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Colesevelam on How the Body Responds to Insulin in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Colesevelam on Insulin Sensitivity in Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to assess the potential mechanism of action by which WelCholÂ® (colesevelam) may improve blood glucose control in patients with type 2 diabetes

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in Endogenous (Hepatic) Glucose Output During a High-dose Insulin Infusion From Baseline to After 12 Weeks of Treatment.
primary_outcome.description: The parameter measured is the endogenous (hepatic) glucose output during a high-dose insulin infusion. A decrease after treatment with colesevelam is indicative of greater sensitivity of the liver to insulin.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in Endogenous (Hepatic) Glucose Output During a Low-dose Insulin Infusion From Baseline to Week 12.
primary_outcome.description: The parameter measured is the endogenous (hepatic) glucose output during a low-dose insulin infusion. A decrease is indicative of greater senstitivity of the liver to insulin.

primary_outcome.measure: Acute Effect of a Single Dose of Colesevelam on Oral Glucose Absorption From Baseline to First Dose
primary_outcome.description: Change in area under the curve for glucose (AUCg) after a glucose tolerance test. A decrease in AUCg is indicative of a drug effect.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Acute Effect of Colesevelam (Multiple Doses) on Oral Glucose Absorption From Baseline to 12 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The parameter measured is the change in area under the curve for glucose(AUCg) after an oral glucose tolerance test. A decrease in AUCg indicative of drug effect on glucose absorption.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Hemoglobin A1C Due to Effect of Colesevelam From Baseline to 12 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The parameter measured is the percent of hemoglobin A that is glycosylated. A decrease in this parameter is indicative of improved glucose control.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients between the ages of 18 - 75, inclusive
- Diagnosed with type 2 diabetes
- Hemoglobin A1c value greater than or equal to 8.0%
- Antidiabetic treatments may include sulfonylurea agents (non-sulfonylurea agents must be withdrawn)
- Overweight, obese (body mass index 25-45 kg/m2)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Change of dose of lipid or blood pressure lowering therapy within past three months
- Previous treatment with colesevelam for hyperlipidemia
- Serum triglyceride greater than 500 mg/dL
- Serum low density lipoprotein-cholesterol less than 60 mg/dL

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited from 21 June 2005 to 22 January 2008 at 3 clinical research sites in the United States of America.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Subjects were taken off any non-sulfonylurea oral anti-diabetic agents for a period of time appropriate to the drug. Qualified subjects were randomized to colesevelam hydrochloride, placebo, or open-label insulin glargine for 12 weeks. Difficulties enrolling into the insulin group caused the size of this group to decrease from 15 to 6 subjects.

outcome.title: Difference in Endogenous (Hepatic) Glucose Output During a High-dose Insulin Infusion From Baseline to After 12 Weeks of Treatment.
outcome.description: The parameter measured is the endogenous (hepatic) glucose output during a high-dose insulin infusion. A decrease after treatment with colesevelam is indicative of greater sensitivity of the liver to insulin.
outcome.population: The population analyzed was all randomized subjects who received medication and had a baseline and at least 1 post-randomization assessment of an efficacy variable. One placebo participant did not have a valid post-randomization insulin clamp study. Therefore, the number included in the placebo group for this analysis was 13.

measure.title: Difference in Endogenous (Hepatic) Glucose Output During a High-dose Insulin Infusion From Baseline to After 12 Weeks of Treatment.
measure.description: The parameter measured is the endogenous (hepatic) glucose output during a high-dose insulin infusion. A decrease after treatment with colesevelam is indicative of greater sensitivity of the liver to insulin.
measure.population: The population analyzed was all randomized subjects who received medication and had a baseline and at least 1 post-randomization assessment of an efficacy variable. One placebo participant did not have a valid post-randomization insulin clamp study. Therefore, the number included in the placebo group for this analysis was 13.

outcome.title: Difference in Endogenous (Hepatic) Glucose Output During a Low-dose Insulin Infusion From Baseline to Week 12.
outcome.description: The parameter measured is the endogenous (hepatic) glucose output during a low-dose insulin infusion. A decrease is indicative of greater senstitivity of the liver to insulin.
outcome.population: The population analyzed was all randomized subjects who received medication and had a baseline and at least 1 post-randomization assessment of an efficacy variable. One placebo participant did not have a valid post-randomization insulin clamp study. Therefore, the number included in the placebo group for this analysis was 13.

measure.title: Difference in Endogenous (Hepatic) Glucose Output During a Low-dose Insulin Infusion From Baseline to Week 12.
measure.description: The parameter measured is the endogenous (hepatic) glucose output during a low-dose insulin infusion. A decrease is indicative of greater senstitivity of the liver to insulin.
measure.population: The population analyzed was all randomized subjects who received medication and had a baseline and at least 1 post-randomization assessment of an efficacy variable. One placebo participant did not have a valid post-randomization insulin clamp study. Therefore, the number included in the placebo group for this analysis was 13.

outcome.title: The Acute Effect of Colesevelam (Multiple Doses) on Oral Glucose Absorption From Baseline to 12 Weeks
outcome.description: The parameter measured is the change in area under the curve for glucose(AUCg) after an oral glucose tolerance test. A decrease in AUCg indicative of drug effect on glucose absorption.
outcome.population: One participant in the colesevelam 3.8g group discontinued. Therefore, 15 participants were included in this analysis.

measure.title: The Acute Effect of Colesevelam (Multiple Doses) on Oral Glucose Absorption From Baseline to 12 Weeks
measure.description: The parameter measured is the change in area under the curve for glucose(AUCg) after an oral glucose tolerance test. A decrease in AUCg indicative of drug effect on glucose absorption.
measure.population: One participant in the colesevelam 3.8g group discontinued. Therefore, 15 participants were included in this analysis.

outcome.title: Change in Hemoglobin A1C Due to Effect of Colesevelam From Baseline to 12 Weeks
outcome.description: The parameter measured is the percent of hemoglobin A that is glycosylated. A decrease in this parameter is indicative of improved glucose control.
outcome.population: One participant in the colesevelam 3.8g group discontinued. Therefore, 15 participants were included in this analysis. The least squares mean is adjusted for baseline values. This corrects for differences in baseline values between treatment groups.

measure.title: Change in Hemoglobin A1C Due to Effect of Colesevelam From Baseline to 12 Weeks
measure.description: The parameter measured is the percent of hemoglobin A that is glycosylated. A decrease in this parameter is indicative of improved glucose control.
measure.population: One participant in the colesevelam 3.8g group discontinued. Therefore, 15 participants were included in this analysis. The least squares mean is adjusted for baseline values. This corrects for differences in baseline values between treatment groups.

outcome.title: Acute Effect of a Single Dose of Colesevelam on Oral Glucose Absorption From Baseline to First Dose
outcome.description: Change in area under the curve for glucose (AUCg) after a glucose tolerance test. A decrease in AUCg is indicative of a drug effect.
outcome.population: The entire study population was included in this analysis

measure.title: Acute Effect of a Single Dose of Colesevelam on Oral Glucose Absorption From Baseline to First Dose
measure.description: Change in area under the curve for glucose (AUCg) after a glucose tolerance test. A decrease in AUCg is indicative of a drug effect.
measure.population: The entire study population was included in this analysis

reported_events.time_frame: 12 week treatment period plus 30 days after the last dose of study medication.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
